configProperty.name: net.sf.jasperreports.json.date.pattern
configProperty.description: Parameter/property holding the format pattern used to instantiate java.util.Date instances.

configProperty.name: net.sf.jasperreports.json.field.expression
configProperty.description: Property specifying the JSON expression for the dataset field in case a JSON data source is used. This mapping was previously specified using the fieldDescription attribute, but using this custom property is now recommended.

configProperty.name: net.sf.jasperreports.json.locale.code
configProperty.description:
Built-in parameter/property holding the java.lang.String code of the locale to be used when parsing the JSON data.
The allowed format is: language[_country[_variant]]

configProperty.name: net.sf.jasperreports.json.number.pattern
configProperty.description: Parameter/property holding the format pattern used to instantiate java.lang.Number instances.

configProperty.name: net.sf.jasperreports.json.source
configProperty.description:
Built-in parameter/property holding the value of the source for the JSON file.
It can be:
a resource on the classpath
a file from the filesystem, with an absolute or relative path
a url

configProperty.name: net.sf.jasperreports.json.timezone.id
configProperty.description: Built-in parameter/property holding the java.lang.String value of the time zone id to be used when parsing the JSON data.

configProperty.name: net.sf.jasperreports.jsonql.field.expression
configProperty.description: Property specifying the JSONQL expression for the dataset field.

configProperty.name: net.sf.jasperreports.export.json.boolean.{path}
configProperty.description: This element-level property is considered by the JsonMetadataExporter and provides the exported value of a boolean type for that element. This value will be exported within the JSON tree following the path specified by the property suffix.

configProperty.name: net.sf.jasperreports.export.json.data
configProperty.description:
This element-level property is considered by the JsonMetadataExporter and provides the exported value for that element. By default is considered the value of the report element itself.
When working with this property, numbers have to be written with no thousand separators and using a period as decimal. For instance, 1,000,000 should be written as "1000000" and 2,000.45 should be written as "2000.45". Dates must be written according to ISO 8601 standard: "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss".

configProperty.name: net.sf.jasperreports.export.json.date.{path}
configProperty.description:
This element-level property is considered by the JsonMetadataExporter and provides the exported value of a date type for that element. This value will be exported within the JSON tree following the path specified by the property suffix.
When working with this property, dates must be written according to ISO 8601 standard: "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss".

configProperty.name: net.sf.jasperreports.export.json.escape.members
configProperty.description: This report-level flag is considered by the JsonMetadataExporter and specifies if the member property names should be enclosed with quotes or no.

configProperty.name: net.sf.jasperreports.export.json.number.{path}
configProperty.description:
This element-level property is considered by the JsonMetadataExporter and provides the exported value of a numeric type for that element. This value will be exported within the JSON tree following the path specified by the property suffix.
When working with this property, numbers have to be written with no thousand separators and using a period as decimal. For instance, 1,000,000 should be written as "1000000" and 2,000.45 should be written as "2000.45".

configProperty.name: net.sf.jasperreports.export.json.path
configProperty.description: This element-level property is used by the JsonMetadataExporter and specifies a given path within the JSON tree, where the current element will be exported. If the net.sf.jasperreports.export.json.schema property is not present in the report, this property can be used to determine a rule in the JSON schema as well.

configProperty.name: net.sf.jasperreports.export.json.repeat.value
configProperty.description: This element-level flag is considered by the JsonMetadataExporter and specifies whether the value associated to the JSON path specified by net.sf.jasperreports.export.json.path property should be repeated or not when it is missing.

configProperty.name: net.sf.jasperreports.export.json.repeat.{path}
configProperty.description: This element-level flag is considered by the JsonMetadataExporter and specifies whether the value associated to that JSON path should be repeated or not when it is missing. Usually this property works in conjunction with one of the net.sf.jasperreports.export.json.{type}.{path} properties.

configProperty.name: net.sf.jasperreports.export.json.schema
configProperty.description:
This report-level property is considered by the JsonMetadataExporter and specifies the path to a JSON schema file that will be used to generate the JSON structure at export time. Nodes in a given schema should provide:
the _type property (mandatory), which can be an object or an array.
the _children property (mandatory for array-type nodes), which defines the type of the objects in the array.
other properties that describe the object.

configProperty.name: net.sf.jasperreports.export.json.string.{path}
configProperty.description: This element-level property is considered by the JsonMetadataExporter and provides the exported value of a String type for that element. This value will be exported within the JSON tree following the path specified by the property suffix.
